channel.title: idle temperature paranoia
channel.description: lately my GEFORCE 9600GT has been idling around the 57-59 celsius areas, where previously it would idle around 48-49 and that's been worrying me a bit. so, i just want to know at what temperature i should install a fire extinguisher next to my desk, thanks.

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Jeannotvb:

not a compressor

Pardon me, I can be a noob at times but why is this?

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
Right, thanks for that. Went ingame, and found I get during average gameplay 4 frames per second. If I’m lucky, 5.

I don’t believe my graphics card is that bad…

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Bad_D0g
item.description:
m4rek:

If there’s a command to show the fps in TF2 without having to run another program to get an overlay to do it, let me know so that I can tell you just how bad it is.

Type “cl_showfps 2” in the console, and you get a color-coded fps counter in the top right corner

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
Thing is, I’ve only just had it replaced after… get this… the CPU, GPU and PSU were written off because they were fried. Used to hit 100, 110… Now tell ya what, even I know that ain’t healthy.

However, TF2 used to be playable on this machine. As was HL2 and other source games; and that was with decent settings. Right now I can’t even play it on minimum because of the performance. If there’s a command to show the fps in TF2 without having to run another program to get an overlay to do it, let me know so that I can tell you just how bad it is. It’s certainly below 30 on minimum. Best guess, below 10; maybe around 6.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
ouch those specs will only get you so far…

I think you’re getting normal performance in TF2 but your GPU temp could be lower, you should really consider a GPU upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
My GPU hits 80 when playing TF2… Would that explain why it runs so damn badly on min even though the recommended settings are fairly high? O_o

EDIT:
Just getting some more data…

GPU (TF2) max: 78
GPU Idle: ~67
CPU Max: 73
CPU Idle: ~55

Also recently developed a problem where the computer will freeze completely, (though it could be the video output freezing, no way I know to tell the difference), and requires a cold boot…

Booting now takes 8 minutes to get past the initial boot screen, (thus arriving at the Windows XP [loading bar] screen) for a total boot time of 10 minutes :fffuuu:

Still waiting for it to restart to tell you the specs and other useful info… (accidentally kicked it, which causes it to restart due to power failure… I think the power button wiring has come loose somewhere)

Moar Edit:

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce 7300 SE/7200 GS, 512MB
CPU: Intel Pentium 4, 3.40GHz, (2CPUs) ~Hyperthreaded?
1024MB RAM

Anything else needed, I am happy to provide, just let me use my computer again :’(

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
If your PSU fan(s) are spinning and the voltages are more or less where they should be you’re fine.

Anyway, it doesn’t have to be a heat issue but it’s still probably a GPU failure.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
I could probably burn myself on the outside of my PSU air outlet… Is this healthy?

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: super_lurker
item.description:
i put a can of compressed air to the thing and dusted and cleaned most of my computer, now it’s idling at a toasty 58 degrees celsius. i don’t think that was the problem

is the heat noticeable by touch?

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
By XP Mode he means the compatibility mode. Right click the program .exe and click properties, go to the compatibility tab, and there’s the “Run in” or something like that box and you can choose what OS compatibility to run the program in.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Grum
item.description:
it’s not a heating issue. If it was the computer would just shut itself down. Nothing is overheating. The computer doesn’t freeze. The games do, and I can minimize out of them and get back in. XP mode? My OS is Windows Vista 64-bit.

Yes, i’ve installed and uninstalled so many different drivers. Nothing works.

Even used Driver Sweeper

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
get your hands on a copy of everest (i dont care how u get it) and post the lowest and highest temp of atleast your cpu and chipset. perhaps even your voltages. Other then that, i spose you could try running the game as admin + maybe even run in xp mode. Also check if your drivers are actually even installed (i know my mates 250gts kept having default drivers installed).

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
It may very well just be a faulty card. That’d be my first guess if it’s a new card and you’re only getting up to 75 degrees.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Grum
item.description:
I think it’s safe to say that this is no heat issue of any kind. I have opened up the case. Set fan speed to 100. This did not work. So I got a small household fan, and put it infront of the open case, and turned it on full speed. My computer is COLD! Only way it could get any colder is if I put it in the fucking fridge! THIS DID NOT WORK. My video card was idling at 38-40 degrees and in-game only reached up to 60. I don’t know what to do. I’ve installed and uninstalled all sorts of drivers. Nothing works.

Also, this power supply is new. I got it just for the new card.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: bulbman
item.description:
I also have a 9600 gt, it was idling at around 68-72C, so I opened up the GPU, replaced the thermal paste, cleaned out the fan, and I also have my pc case open with a small fan aimed directly at the GPU, never goes over 54C.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
yeah i know what your saying, but its proberly best if we rule everything else out before going and saying

“oh shit bro, replace your video card and itll be sweet”

the only other thing related to video card that hasnt been stated yet is this.
Try the normal nvidia drivers. (or the branded ones)

If that doesnt work, once again the temp’s would be nice. And while your at it, give us your voltages for good measure

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Grum
item.description:
So I played Batman: Arkham Asylym for about 2 hours today. It only froze twice during that time. But I was able to ctr alt delete (minimize) and get back into it as if nothing had happened within a few seconds.

I think that something is overheating and causing minor freezing. But I don’t think it’s the video card.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
Grum:

I have been having similar problems. Even though my comp idles at 49 degrees. Whenever I play L4D2 it’ll eventually freeze around 70-75 degrees. The game freezes in a constant sound loop. I’m able to minimize and get back into it, don’t have to restart the computer. But it just wont stop freezing…

The card I use is a Nvidia GeForce EVGA GTX 275. It’s a new card, and it seems to give off a lot of heat. I’ve reinstalled my drivers and everything. Same problem. If around 70 is a decent temperature, then I don’t get why L4D2 is freezing. Oh yeah, same problem with TF2. Except it doesn’t happen as quickly or often with TF2.

ASUS motherboards sometimes put the back-to-back CAS delay for memory to zero which causes the system to lock up randomly no matter how much it’s under load with a looping sound. 75 C on the GPU shouldn’t lock up your computer, chipset overheating could be the problem as they are often positioned behind the videocard. Idle chipset is 40 C, 30 C ideal. Try not to go past 60 C which is known to cause stability issues.

If your motherboard heats up when the videocard is under stress then you might want to consider moving the graphics card a slot up or down depending on what motherboard you have to give the chipset some more room.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Patonki
item.description:
I haven’t even opened my computer since I bought it 2 years ago. My temperatures are OKAY I guess

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: Grum
item.description:
Hm. Lets see here. Well, it’s an HP Pavilion. Processor: Intel® Core™2 Quad CPU Q9650 @ 3.00 GHz 3.00 GHz

memory 6.00 GB

System Type: 64-bit Operating System. Windows Vista.

Those temps I mentioned before are from my graphics card (GTX 275). I have this software that tells me my cards GPU temps and adjust my fan speed. I’m not really sure how to check my temps for all that other stuff.

I did a memory diagnostics test and it looks like it passed. No errors were found. So far this has only happened on TF2 and L4D2. I haven’t tried any other games yet. Just re-formated recently and I do have the latest drivers. Even reinstalled them one time. Still nothin’.

EDIT: Also I should mention that it’s not my comp that freezes. Just the game. It just freezes on a sound loop. I can still minimize and then maximize again and still be in the game. But yeah, no restart on the computer required.

Read full topic

item.title: idle temperature paranoia
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
Grum:

I have been having similar problems. Even though my comp idles at 49 degrees. Whenever I play L4D2 it’ll eventually freeze around 70-75 degrees. The game freezes in a constant sound loop. I’m able to minimize and get back into it, don’t have to restart the computer. But it just wont stop freezing…

The card I use is a Nvidia GeForce EVGA GTX 275. It’s a new card, and it seems to give off a lot of heat. I’ve reinstalled my drivers and everything. Same problem. If around 70 is a decent temperature, then I don’t get why L4D2 is freezing. Oh yeah, same problem with TF2. Except it doesn’t happen as quickly or often with TF2.

judging from experience, i wouldnt start pointing fingers at your gpu. 75 is fine. check all your other temps, (cpu, chipset). If my computer suddenly froze, i would either be playing sacred 2 or my cpu just overheated (time to clean the zalman lol)

post your system specs and include all your temps right before the freeze. That way we can rule out your temp’s. Would also be handy to know your OS.

And cheer up grum, atleast your spare rig doesnt OC itself when you launch a game. its like a crappy athlon 4600+ x2. Open up css and view the cpu speed, it says like 4.5ghz, to achieve that speed im guessing it throttles something back because it doesnt overheat :\

Read full topic
